title: Social Domain Project-Based Learning Through Self-Regulated Learning Strategy Training

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centered limited-technology environments, learners apply self-regulated learning strategies to projects focused on social sector topics

learning_goals: Learners complete social field projects with over 80% completion by utilizing self-regulated learning strategies (goal setting, time management, self-assessment)

Learners record weekly learning progress (completion rates, understanding, time spent) at over 80% accuracy using smartphone-based tools (e.g., Google Sheets, Notion), fulfill three or more of five weekly evaluation checklist items, and adjust/execute two or more learning plans for the following week.

Learners resolve difficulties encountered during project-based activities by applying self-regulated strategies and achieve a score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) in learning satisfaction surveys

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
